intro: Mesembryanthemum rectum, commonly known as the "arrowleaf ice plant," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are typically arrow-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum rectum is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
